title: Make a San Diego Comic-Con Pitstop at the Sonic the Hedgehog Speed Cafe
description:
io9 is at San Diego Comic-Con 2023 and we made a pre-convention center detour to the Sonic the Hedgehog Speed Cafe, a fast food activation inspired by SEGA’s Sonic the Hedgehog video game universe.

Read more...

title: James Cameron Is More Worried About an AI Apocalypse Than an AI Movie Script for Now
description:
Fears over the increasing and encroaching role of large language models and other generative AI tools in media have become the heart of Hollywood’s current labor struggle, as the WGA and SAG-AFTRA have both centered safeguards for human workers in the face of an industry eager to jump on the latest tech bandwagon. But…

Read more...

title: Juul Seeks FDA Approval for New Vape That Can Verify a User's Age
description:
Juul is requesting FDA approval for an updated version of its e-cigarette a year after it was forced to briefly remove its fruity-flavored devices from the market. The new e-cigarette reportedly has age-verification capabilities and a unique Pod ID chip that will prevent consumers from using counterfeit pods with the…

Read more...

title: Melania Trump's Apollo 11 NFTs Violate NASA Guidelines
description:
Melania Trump released her latest collection of nonfungible tokens (NFTs), this time commemorating humanity’s giant leap on the Moon with a famous photo of NASA Astronaut Buzz Aldrin walking on the lunar surface. There’s just one thing though: NASA does not approve the use of its imagery for the digital tokens.

Read more...

title: Aquaman 2's Reported Production Problems Already Seem Lost At Sea
description:
Did you know that Aquaman (2018) is the highest grossing DC Universe movie? At least according to The Hollywood Reporter, it is the “highest grossing” DC movie of all time at 1.148 billion dollars. Which, absolutely bonkers considering what a weird over-developed riot of CGI that film was. And of course the sequel, …

Read more...

title: Stanford President to Step Down Over Allegations He Manipulated Mountains of Science
description:
The most preeminent member of one of the U.S.’s most preeminent universities plans to step down in a month’s time. The news out of Stanford comes after student journalists uncovered allegations that their dear leader’s old lab had manipulated data in dozens of major scientific papers published in many preeminent…

Read more...

title: Doctor Who's New Sonic Screwdriver Is a Blinding Throwback
description:
A new incarnation of the Doctor—even if they have a very familiar face—means, inevitably, a new sonic screwdriver for them to wave about the place with reckless Time Lord abandon. David Tennant’s 14th Doctor is no exception, but his updated tool of choice is suitably new and familiar at the same time.

Read more...

title: The Impact of AMPTP's Refusal to Negotiate Fairly Will Add Up Fast
description:
There is nothing more satisfying than when bosses realize who does the work needed to make them money. While the WGA successfully picketed and shut down productions on both coasts, the SAG-AFTRA action shut down productions shooting internationally, like Interview With the Vampire and Gladiator 2. And now, according…

Read more...

title: Florida Man Blames 'Wokeness' for Fragile Insurance Market
description:
Jimmy Patronis, Florida’s chief financial officer, is threatening to investigate insurance companies that leave the state. Patronis blames “wokeness” for the moves, not rampant lawsuits or climate change.

Read more...

title: Is ChatGPT Getting Worse?
description:
ChatGPT is changing, though so far it’s been incredibly hard to say how or why. Users have widely complained that the GPT-4 language model powering the paid version of OpenAI’s chatbot has been degrading over time, spitting out false answers and declining to follow through on prompts it once happily abided. New…

Read more...

title: Apple Is Reportedly Making Fast Progress on Its Own 'Apple GPT'
description:
The AI gold rush is showing no signs of slowing down. As ChatGPT continues to enamor the world with its strings of relatively coherent text, Apple is looking for its piece of the pie by developing its own artificial intelligence engine.

Read more...

title: The Rise and Fall (and Rise Again) of the E-Wing, Star Wars' Legendary Starfighter
description:
When the Star Wars Expanded Universe began to take nascent steps towards building a world beyond the original movie trilogy, it dug into the same questions Disney and Lucasfilm explored decades later in creating the sequel trilogy. What does Star Wars look like in this new time? What parts of its world have evolved?…

Read more...

title: Instagram’s Threads Adds Some New Features, Still Falls Short of Being a True Twitter Clone
description:
Threads is getting some new feature updates, inching it a little closer to the Twitter clone that was promised. The updated features will include a followers list, the option to subscribe to unfollowed users, and a revised “follows” tab, Threads developer Cameron Roth, said in a Threads post. Unfortunately, the most…

Read more...

title: The Venture Bros. Creators on Superheroes, Super Nerds, and Saying Goodbye
description:
Long-running, much-loved Adult Swim series The Venture Bros. may sadly be over, but there’s some consolation, and some sense of closure, for its many fans: five years after its seventh season ended, a direct-to-video film—The Venture Bros.: Radiant is the Blood of the Baboon Heart (yes, the title makes sense once you…

title: Two-Faced: Wacky White Dwarf Keeps Its Surface Gases Separate
description:
Astronomers have discovered an ancient stellar remnant that keeps its light elements separate, in a strange first.

Read more...

title: Secret Invasion's Plot Craters, But Leaves Little Impact
description:
We are in the penultimate episode of Marvel’s Disney+ series Secret Invasion, and, surprisingly, we don’t have a lot of questions or plot points to wrap up. After the first four episodes of the Samuel L. Jackson-led spy-thriller series, most mysteries have been solved or explained in... Gravik detail. (Get it?…

title: Good Omens Season 2 Reminds Us That Everyone Should Feel Welcome
description:
Good Omens fans know what it means to pine for a couple to be together. Season two adds more shipping to the mix with Nina (Nina Sosanya) and Maggie (Maggie Service), shopkeeper neighbors of bookselling angel Aziraphale (Michael Sheen). If their names and faces are familiar, that’s because you’ve seen them together…

Read more...

title: Astro Barbie: Pair of Dolls That Went to Space Now on Display at the Smithsonian
description:
In February 2022, two Barbie dolls responded to an unusual call: “Come on Barbie, let’s go party.....to space.” Dressed in white spacesuits, the pair spent a few months aboard the International Space Station (ISS) among real-life astronauts. Now that they’re back on Earth, the two astronaut Barbies are on display at…

Read more...

title: Biden Administration Updates Guidelines on Busting Up Monopolies
description:
In the wake of legal turmoil that has stalled—but not prevented—a merger between Microsoft and Activision, the Biden administration has opted to revisit the guidelines that the Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission will use to assess mergers and acquisitions under the lens of federal antitrust laws.

Read more...

title: Google Is Restricting Internet Access for Some Employees to Combat Cyberattacks
description:
Google is restricting some employees’ Internet access in a pilot program created to combat cyberattacks. An internal memo informed employees that 2,500 were selected to use the internet-free desktop PCs, but the memo was revised to include the caveat that they have the option to opt out of the program while others can…

Read more...

title: Study Pushes Back Interactions Between Copper Age Europeans By a Millennium
description:
Researchers poring over genomes of people who lived during the Copper Age have found older cultural contacts between ancient groups than previously known.

Read more...

title: A New Haunting In Venice Trailer Pits Poirot Against the Supernatural
description:
One of Agatha Christie’s most famous characters, Hercule Poirot, returns to the big screen in A Haunting in Venice, the third film to come out of the partnership of director/actor Kenneth Branagh and screenwriter Michael Green. The previous two films; Murder on the Orient Express (2017) and Death on the Nile (2022),…

Read more...

title: Reddit's Newest Offense: Making Its iOS App Icon Ugly as Hell
description:
It is entirely possible that we are witnessing the death of one of the internet’s favorite social media platforms in real-time. After charging for access to its API and attempting to squash subsequent protests via interviews with the hare-brained CEO, Reddit has now made its iOS app icon into a tacky, 8-bit…

Read more...

title: Maybe Don't Get Too Excited About Those Gargoyles Rumors After All
description:
Get a new look at the upcoming Pet Sematary prequel. The cast of Barbie gush over Greta Gerwig in a new featurette. Plus, what’s coming on Riverdale and Secret Invasion this week, and a turtle-tot-tastic new clip from TMNT: Mutant Mayhem. Spoilers, away!

Read more...

title: Indian Officials ‘Can Neither Confirm Nor Deny Anything’ About Mystery Object Found in Australia
description:
The provenance of a large metallic object that washed ashore near Jurien Bay in Western Australia this past weekend remains unknown, despite rampant speculation about it hailing from an Indian PSLV launch vehicle.

Read more...

title: The Beats Studio Pro Bring Solid ANC, But Are Missing Features You Expect From $350 Wireless Headphones
description:
As we said back in 2017, when the Beats Studio3 Wireless headphones debuted, Beats’ products have been getting better and better since Apple bought the company and started contributing to their design and hardware. The new Beats Studio Pro, the first new addition to the Beats Studio line in six years, bring excellent…

Read more...

title: The ‘Basic’ Netflix Subscription Is Now All But Deceased
description:
Whelp, I guess we all knew this was coming. With no formal announcement, Netflix removed its $9.99 “Basic” subscription tier for anybody trying to sign up for a new account or resubscribe in the U.S. and UK. Now your two options are to pay $5.50 more per month for the “Standard” plan, or otherwise suffer through…

Read more...

title: New Ahsoka Lego Star Wars Sets Feature Her Ship and More
description:
Begun, the Comic-Con news, has. Though the convention won’t start until later this evening, Lego is already breaking news by revealing three brand new Star Wars sets that’ll be revealed at the event. Two are from Star Wars Ahsoka, the upcoming show coming to Disney+ on August 23, and the third is a big, brick-built…

Read more...

title: Wheel of Time Season 2 Reveals a Mystical First Trailer
description:
Though its San Diego Comic-Con panel was understandably cancelled in light of the ongoing SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes in Hollywood, Prime Video’s Wheel of Time still has a treat for fans: a first trailer for season two. It reveals a dramatic glimpse of the battles ahead.

Read more...

title: This Robotic Transforming Grimlock Is a Masterpiece of Engineering and an Expensive $1,699 Collectible
description:
In 2021, Robosen and Hasbro left ‘80s toys fans with their jaws on the floor after revealing a $700 robotic Optimus Prime that could autonomously transform from the Autobot leader to a Freightliner truck. Two years later, Optimus is finally getting some backup with a new robotic Grimlock that transforms nearly exactly…

Read more...

title: U.S. Blacklists Two More Israeli Spyware Companies
description:
The U.S. government placed two Israeli spyware companies on a blacklist this week, all but totally cutting them off from business opportunities with American firms. The move is yet another attempt by the Biden administration to clean up the ethically bankrupt spyware industry before it spins totally out of control.

Read more...

title: Henry Cavill's Witcher Training Reached Superman Levels of Intensity
description:
To be the musk created by the strength of Henry Cavill swinging his sword, one can only imagine while watching The Witcher star train with stunt coordinator and second unit director Wolfgang Stegemann.
